meanings.meaning: EGR stands for Exhaust Gas Recirculation. It is part of the vehicle emmissions system, and is used to reduce combustion temperature and pressure to control Oxides of Nitrogen. There are generally three parts to the EGR system: the EGR valve, an actuator solenoid, and a differential pressure sensor EGR (DPFE). These things work together to deliver the correct amount of recirculation based on engine temperature, load, etc. The P0401 code means that OBD detected an insufficient amount of EGR.

causes.cause: The DPFE (differential pressure feedback EGR) sensor is faulty and needs to be replaced
The EGR valve may not be opening due to a lack of vaccuum
There is a blockage in the EGR (tube), most likely carbon buildup

solutions.solution: Check the voltage at the DPFE, compare to specified values (refer to a repair manual for your specific model)
Clean out the EGR valve and/or tubing to remove deposits
Replace the DPFE sensor (with a good quality / OEM one)
Use a vacuum pump and pull the EGR valve open while monitoring engine RPM's & DPFE voltage. There should be a noticable difference in RPM's with the EGR open

symptoms.symptom: You may notice drivability problems such as pinging (a.k.a. preignition knock) when the engine is under load or the vehicle is at higher speeds. There may also be other symptoms.
